title: Sinkhole Traps Boats In Shropshire Canal | 10 News
description: A massive sinkhole has opened in a canal in England’s Shropshire county, trapping two boats in deep mud and damaging a third.  Emergency services declared a major incident after a significant breach of the Shropshire Union Canal in Whitchurch.  More than 10 people were rescued as crews worked through unstable ground and rapidly moving water, with no injuries reported.  The affected section of the canal has been dammed off while investigators work to determine the cause of the collapse. title: Trump Says US Needs Greenland For National Security | 10 News
description: President Donald Trump has renewed calls to take over Greenland, stating the United States needs to have the country, not for critical minerals but for “national security”.  It follows Trump naming Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry as his special envoy to the self-governing Danish territory on Sunday, sparking new tensions between the nation’s leaders.  Denmark’s Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen stating, “I am very upset about this appointment of a special envoy. And I am particularly upset about the envoy's statements, which we find completely unacceptable." title: Islamic Prayer Hall in Sydney’s Southwest Shut Down Amid Hate Speech Crackdown | 10 News
description: A controversial Islamic prayer hall has been shut down by a Southwest Sydney council which says it was being run 'illegally' as state and federal leaders crack down on hate speech in the wake of the Bondi attack.     It comes as the federal government reveals what its gun and hate speech reforms will look like.  But the Prime Minister is continuing to resist calls for a Commonwealth Royal Commission. title: NSW Pushes Ahead With Toughest-in-Country Gun & Protest Reforms Amid Legal Challenges | 10 News
description: The New South Wales government is pushing ahead with its sweeping gun and protest crackdown.   An all-night parliamentary sitting saw the lower house pass reforms billed as being the toughest in the country.  But today - as it was fiercely debated in the upper house - a constitutional challenge in the courts, was already being mounted. title: Senior Russian General Killed In Moscow Car Bomb, Zelenskyy Fears Possible Russian Strike | 10 News
description: A senior Russian general has been killed by a car bomb in Moscow, in what the Kremlin suspects was a targeted assassination by Ukraine.  Peace talks continue at a frustratingly slow pace - with President Zelenskyy now fearing a massive strike by Russia over Christmas. title: Libyan Army Chief Mohammed Al-Haddad Dies In Türkiye Plane Crash | 10 News
description: Libya’s army chief of staff, Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad, has died after a military jet crashed shortly after departing Türkiye’s capital, Ankara.  Turkish authorities said the jet requested an emergency landing before crashing in a rural district south of Ankara, with debris later located by search teams.  Libya’s prime minister said radio contact was lost with the aircraft as it travelled to Tripoli, carrying Haddad and four others.  The cause of the crash is not yet known. The incident comes a day after Türkiye extended the mandate of its military deployment in Libya, where it backs the Tripoli-based government. description: What should have been the quintessential Australian beach holiday has ended in violence for a Norwegian tourist in Melbourne. title: Former Prince Andrew Believed To Feature Heavily In Latest Jeffrey Epstein Files Drop | 10 News
description: Emails from a new batch of Epstein Files appear to show Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor - the former Duke of York - requesting 'inappropriate friends' from one of the convicted pedophile's close associates.   Donald Trump has once again been dragged into the saga, with separate emails indicating he may have flown on Epstein's private jet more often than previously thought. title: Two ISIS Terrorists Found Guilty Of Planning Attack On Jewish Community In Manchester, UK | 10 News
description: A British court has found two men guilty of planning an attack on Jews in Manchester in what police believe could have been the UK's worst terror attack.  One of the men was arrested by heavily armed police in a car park in Bolton, as he was taking delivery of three guns and hundreds of rounds of ammunition.
